definitions.definition: an activity that you do as well as your main job:
examples: Jim works in a bank, but teaches French in the evenings as a sideline.

definitions.definition: a line that shows the position of the side of an area where a sport is played:
examples: The ball fell just inside/on/outside the sideline.

definitions.definition: If a sports player is sidelined they are prevented from playing or competing, and can only watch:
examples: Johnson has been sidelined through injury.

definitions.definition: to stop someone taking an active and important part in something:
examples: He was sidelined after criticizing the policy.
